00249 
00251   unsigned numberOfNeurons;   
00252 
00255   unsigned numberOfParameters;
00256 
00257 
00258   // the variable that counts the time (backwards!) when processing a data series
00259   unsigned time;      
00260   
00261   // Number of different time steps in the network architecture:
00262   // delay = 1 means only feed forward, delay > 1 also includes
00263   // the history of the states into the dynamic.
00264   unsigned delay;         
00265 
00266   //
00267   unsigned episode;
00268 
00269   // Number of patterns of the input sequence, which are not
00270   // considered for evaluating the error and gradient of the
00271   // error. Nevertheless, these elements are used to modify the
00272   // internal states of the neurons.
00273   unsigned warmUpLength;
00274 
00275   // 3-dimensional connection matrix. The first dimension is the time
00276   // delay, the second and third dimension are the neuron indices of
00277   // the endpoint and starting point of the connection as given
00278   // in a "normal" connection matrix.
00279   ArrayTable<int> connectionMatrix;
00280 
00281   // 3-dimensional weight matrix. The first dimension is the time
00282   // delay, the second and third dimension are the neuron indices of
00283   // the endpoint and starting point of the connection, the weight
00284   // belongs to, as given in a "normal" weight matrix.
00285   ArrayTable<double> weightMatrix;
00286 
00287   // 1-dimensional array with the number of elements equal to the
00288   // number of time delays in the structure. The i-th element of this
00289   // array is set to one, if at least one connection from the i-th memory layer
00290   // to the feed-forward layer exists. This variable is only used to
00291   // reduce the computational time.
00292   ArrayTable<int> delMask;
00293 
00294   // Activation of the neurons prior to the processings, usually equal
00295   // to the input pattern. Stimulus is a 1-dimensional array with the
00296   // number of elements equal to the number of neurons.
00297   ArrayTable<double> stimulus;
00298 
00299   // Activation of the neurons after processing the time series. "Y"
00300   // is a 2-dimensional array, the first dimension gives the neuron
00301   // index, the second one the time step counted backwards.
00302   // Therefore, the second dimension's number of elements is equal to
00303   // the sum of the length of the time series and the maximum time
00304   // delay of the structure.
00305   ArrayTable<double> Y;
00306 
00307   // This array stores the errors of the neurons for every input
00308   // pattern.
00309   ArrayTable<double> err;
00310 
00311   // Stores the local delta values which are used to evaluate the
00312   // gradient.
00313   ArrayTable<double> delta;
00314 
00315   // Derivative of the error with respect to the weights. This object is 
00316   // a 3-dimensional array, the first dimension is the time
00317   // delay, the second and third dimension are the neuron indices of
00318   // the endpoint and starting point of the connection, the weight
00319   // belongs to.
00320   ArrayTable<double> dEw; 
00321 
00322   // Activation function of all neurons.
00323   virtual double g(double);
00324 
00325   // Computes the derivative of g(a) for all neurons.
00326   virtual double dg(double);
00327 
00328   // Initializes some internal variables.
00329   void init0();
00330 
00331   // Writes the values of the weights stored in the weight matrix to 
00332   // the parameter vector w of ModelInterface.
00333   void writeParameters();
00334 
00335   // Reads the values of the parameter vector w of ModelInterface
00336   // and stores these values in the weight matrix.
00337   void readParameters();
00338 
00339   // Writes the values of the gradient of the error with respect to the
00340   // different weights from the variable dEw to the variable
00341   // dedw in the Model Interface.
00342   void writeGradient();
00343 
00344   // Performs some initializations that are necessary to process the
00345   // time series.
00346   void prepareTime(unsigned t);
00347   
00348   // Processes a whole time series. After processing the output can be 
00349   // found in the variable Y.
00350   void processTimeSeries(const Array<double>& input);
00351 
00352   // Processes one input pattern.
00353   void processTimeStep();
00354 
00355   // Performs backpropagation through time to calculate the derivative
00356   // of the error with respect to the weights. The results are stored to
00357   // dEw.
00358   void calcGradBPTT();
00359 };
